text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen now I've 
had a lot of recipe requests for eggplant dishes

now if you've got my book I have a recipe for 
an eggplant stir-fry in there so check it out

but today I'm going to show you one that is 
perfect for the summer and it is a grilled

eggplant salad now in Thai it's called yum makeua 
Yao yum is a type of Thai salad and makeua Yao

is literally long eggplant which is what this 
guy is now in Thailand our long eggplant are

green but here I can only find ones that are 
purple but that's okay they both work just

fine it's super easy and if you know someone who 
doesn't like eggplant or you don't like eggplant

I challenge you feed them this and see if they 
don't change their mind let's get started now

let's deal with the eggplant first now I call this 
a grilled eggplant salad but what I actually like

to do is broil it but you could grill it but 
what you want to do is grill it on high high

heat because you want to char the outside you 
can also just roast this over open flame like

stick it into the fire and roast it until it's 
black you can do that as well some people do

but if you've got an oven this is the easiest 
cleanest way to do it so before we put put it

under the broiler I'm going to poke some holes 
because if you don't poke some holes the heat

and the steam that builds up inside will 
pop open the eggplant which happened to me

the first time and it exploded so I've got my 
broiler on high the rack is on the top I want

maximum heat and I'm going to turn it every two 
to three minutes to make sure all the sides are

evenly charred all right there it is before you 
turn it you want that size to have some black

charred nests and you get a smokiness that is a 
great unique characteristic of this dish now I'm

gonna let this cool while we make the dressing 
all right let's make the dressing which is super

easy but there is a secret ingredient and that 
is dried shrimp okay I use dry sure mots before

but today I've actually got it divided into two 
different sets the first set I've actually got

soaking in hot water and so all you do here 
is boil some water and soak it for about 10

minutes basically until it's cool enough to handle 
and that will soften the shrimp up a little bit

and this other lot I'm going to blitz it up in a 
coffee grinder until it's sort of sloppy and flaky

alright see how nice and fluffy and flaky it is 
and this is a great way to easily incorporate

the flavor of dried shrimp that extra umami flavor 
into various dishes because this will essentially

dissolve into whatever you put in and now for 
the soaked dried shrimp now you can tell that

it's been hydrated enough by the fact that they're 
larger I'm going to just drain this off and just

put it in my mortar and pestle here and I just 
want to pound it just until they break and so

it'll allow them to absorb the dressing a little 
better there we go that's it just a couple times

until it's kind of like this so take this out for 
now so neat the mortar for something else so in

goes my Thai chili just one there's not a lot of 
dressing here so one chili goes a long way and

don't look at it because it likes to jump in your 
eyes okay so just when the chilies are sort of

mashed up like this skins fine just no big chunks 
I'm gonna add my palm sugar and then just mash it

until the palm sugar becomes muddy and pasty sweet 
spicy paste mmm okay and now the fish sauce of

course now have you seen a few of my young videos 
you start to notice some patterns here right the

ingredients for the dressings really don't change 
much yet every dish has its own unique character

alright some lime juice going in always fresh 
never bottles and that's it now this yumm dressing

though I like it to be a little heavier on the 
sweet side so it is a bit sweeter than a normal

young dressing because I find that sweetness 
really works well with the soft tender juiciness

of the eggplant I'm going in with some shallots 
lots of shallots and some chopped cilantro stem

so this is Londres stems that I just chopped up 
finely the leaves I didn't throw away hey save

that for sprinkling on top I'm going to add the 
shrimp fluff and this will almost dissolve into

the dressing it will thicken the dressing just 
ever so slightly mmm get every last [ __ ] that's

what a rubber spatula is good for god I love the 
smell of yumm dressing now we're going to add the

smashed dried shrimp now a lot of people in this 
recipe they like to add fresh shrimp instead of

dried shrimp but I really love that mommy flavor 
the dried shrimp has some people at ground pork

ground chicken but I'm going to keep it meatless 
today apart from the shrimp so the eggplant is

cooled enough to handle now so we're going to 
peel this off so what you want to be careful with

is not to get the charred bit on the flesh and I'm 
just going to run my knife along the skin and peel

it off should come off pretty easily okay I like 
to have it and then I cut it into chunk it evenly

as you can and you need a sharp knife for this 
by the way sort of arrange it nicely on a plate

with the browned side facing out oh honey this 
is so tender and juicy right now this eggplant

if you're in Thailand and you're using Tai Lung 
eggplant this should be a beautiful green color

now all we have to do is pour this dressing over 
the eggplant and sort of the soft nature of the

eggplant will absorb all that wonderful dressing 
oh good that looks a must-have ingredient for

this dish is a medium boiled egg so I've got here 
some duck eggs which is a classic but you can just

use chicken eggs however if you look in Chinese 
grocery stores a lot of times they'll have fresh

duck eggs for sale okay so and duck eggs just 
have a firmer white and a yolk that's a little

more sort of gooey than chicken egg so when it's 
medium boiled or that gooeyness is so perfect and

you can do it in quarters you can do it in half 
or yes oh that is so perfect you know this way

you can still cut it into quarters and it's not 
going to run all over the place there's something

about medium boiled eggs as soon as I put it on 
the plate I start salivating now cuz that looks

so nice I'm going to save that for refills just to 
finish everything off some fresh cilantro leaves

that we saved from earlier so the stem went into 
the dressing and the leaves just get garnished on

top now look at that isn't that pretty and 
I always want to have some rice with this

because this is quite strong on its own the yum 
dressing is very sharp mmm gonna have an egg oh

look at that you want to ration your eggs so 
there's one in every bite okay oh it's actually

a hard dish to describe because there's nothing 
quite like it it is so tender the eggplant once

you get it roasted like this just melt in your 
mouth and the sharpness from the lime and the

dressing mixes with the egg yolk and it just up 
it's just this explosion of luscious creaminess

but at the same time it's light and bright with 
all that tart lime juice you gotta try this and

again I will repeat if you've got friends who 
don't like eggplant or you don't like eggplant

try this out and tell me if that doesn't change 
your mind this is so so spectacular so I hope you

give this a try the recipe as always will be on 
hot Thai Kitchen calm when you make it send me a

photo on Facebook Twitter or Instagram and oh 
I am now also on snapchat so follow me if you

want to see my fun daily adventures and I will 
see you next time for your next delicious tiny
you
